hanzi-su-wiki:
換

Значения

Менять; меняться, заменяться

Мнемоника

Меновая торговля с живущим в пещере 穴 человеком 大, передавать товар из рук в руки 扌.

Варианты

换
purpleculture_pinyin:
huàn
to exchange; to change (clothes etc); to substitute; to switch; to convert (currency)
обменять; переодеться (одежду и т. д.); заменить; переключать; конвертировать (валюта)

heisig_constituent: interchange, finger, fingers, bound up, four, large, St. Bernard
heisig_story: Fingers . . . four St. Bernard dogs bound up.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: interchange, period, change, convert, replace, renew
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: взаимообмен, период, изменения, преобразования, заменить, обновить
koohiiStory1: After months of practice, you finally managed to teach a nice trick to your sled-pulling four bound up St. Bernard dogs: one snap of your fingers and they interchange their positions.
koohiiStory2: On the snap of your fingers, the four St. Bernard dogs bound up interchange places.
jp_example_words:
換える(かえる): to exchange, to interchange, to substitute, to replace
換算(かんさん): conversion, change, exchange
転換(てんかん): convert, divert
乗り換え(のりかえ): transfer (trains buses etc.)
換気(かんき): ventilation
交換(こうかん): exchange, interchange, reciprocity, barter, substitution
乗換(のりかえ): transfer (trains, buses, etc.)
乗り換える(のりかえる): transfer
jp_readingExamples: 換える (か.える), 換わる (か.わる)
WaniKani_Radicals: 扌, 勹, 口, 儿, 大
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: In prison, when you have access to a big number of fingers, mouths, and legs you can exchange them for things that are worth more to you. What are you gonna do with all these body parts in prison? You should exchange them for cigarettes and toilet alcohol.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: You just have so many fingers, mouths, and legs you've pummeled off of the other prisoners. Exchange them for better loot!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You learned this type of exchange from the mighty Genghis Khan (かん). You read a book or watched a show about him once and you're pretty positive that Genghis Khan would exchange the body parts of his enemies all over the continents of Asia and Europe for nicer stuff.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Think back to when you were a kid and they would roll out those TVs on stands into the classrooms. Imagine watching a documentary on Genghis Khan's exchange routes where he bought and sold body parts. Educational!
Ru_Meaning: interchange, period, change, convert, replace, renew
Ru_Radicals: 儿 (ножки), 冂 (перевёрнутая коробка), 勹 (обёртка), 大 (большой), 扎
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the brilliant (奐) hand (扌) can replace
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The victorian lady decides to take up a part time job as a drug dealer for the thrill of it.  Watch how smooth she is with her fingers when she makes an exchange.  Can't even notice her right?!
humanum_full_description_en:
From " hand " to " huan " sound. The original meaning is exchange. "Shuowen": "Change, easy. Congshou, Huansheng." Such as "Han Shu. "Xue Xuan Zhu Bo Biography": "(Xue) Xuan exchanges the counties with Ling Zuo (Yin) and (Xue) Gong. The two look at things for several months, and both counties are governed." Li Bai of the Tang Dynasty "Jiang Jinjiu": " Five-flowered horses, golden hairs, and Hu'er will exchange fine wines, and sell their sorrows with you."

" Exchange " means replacement or replacement. Such as "Mozi. "Prepare the Gate of the City" "When you reach the gate of the city, you will change the staff, and if you don't change it, you can raise it, you don't have to go to the city." It means that when the enemy comes, you need to change the staff and guard from time to time, but you don't need to change the staff, because the staff does not need Up the city wall. Another example is "The Family Instructions of Yan Family. "Feng Cao": "Anyone who avoids taboos must be given the same training in order to replace them: Huan Gong's name is Bai, Bo is known as Wu Hao; Li Wang is long, and Qin has short eyes."

" Change " means change and change. Such as "Hou Han Shu. "Zhu Fengyu and Zheng Zhou's Biographies": "While the one who keeps the slaughter sees easy changes, welcomes the new generation, and fatigues the road." Wang Bo of the Tang Dynasty (Tengwang Pavilion): "The leisure cloud pool has a long shadow day, and things change and stars move several times in autumn."

" Exchange " also means borrowing. "Jade articles. "Hand": "Change, loan also." Such as "Shi Shuo New Language." "Yaliang": "Later, he used his frugality to make his family wealthy, saying that the Taifu's order was exchanged for tens of millions, hoping that he would be stingy, and he could take advantage of it."
humanum_short_description_en: From " hand " to " huan " sound. The original meaning is exchange, but also means replacement, change, etc.
humanum_full_description:
從「手」，「奐」聲。本義是交換。《說文》：「換，易也。从手，奐聲。」如《漢書．薛宣朱博傳》：「（薛）宣即以令奏（尹）賞與（薛）恭換縣。二人視事數月，而兩縣皆治。」唐代李白〈將進酒〉：「五花馬，千金裘，呼兒將出換美酒，與爾同銷萬古愁。」

　　「換」表示更換、替換。如《墨子．備城門》「寇至……時換吏卒署，而毋換亦養，養毋得上城。」意謂敵人來時，要不時更換吏卒防守，但不用更換伙夫，因為伙夫不需要上城牆。又如《顏氏家訓．風操》：「凡避諱者，皆須得其同訓以代換之：桓公名白，博有五皓之稱；厲王名長，琴有修短之目。」

　　「換」表示變易、改變。如《後漢書．朱馮虞鄭周列傳》：「而間者守宰數見換易，迎新相代，疲勞道路。」唐代王勃〈滕王閣〉：「閑雲潭影日悠悠，物換星移幾度秋。」

　　「換」還表示借貸。《玉篇．手部》：「換，貸也。」如《世說新語．雅量》：「後以其性儉家富，說太傅令換千萬，冀其有吝，于此可乘。」
humanum_short_description: 從「手」，「奐」聲。本義是交換，又表示更換、變易等。

從「 手 」，「 奐 」聲。本義是交換。《說文》：「換，易也。从手，奐聲。」如《漢書．薛宣朱博傳》：「（薛）宣即以令奏（尹）賞與（薛）恭換縣。二人視事數月，而兩縣皆治。」唐代李白〈將進酒〉：「五花馬，千金裘，呼兒將出換美酒，與爾同銷萬古愁。」 「 換 」表示更換、替換。如《墨子．備城門》「寇至……時換吏卒署，而毋換亦養，養毋得上城。」意謂敵人來時，要不時更換吏卒防守，但不用更換伙夫，因為伙夫不需要上城牆。又如《顏氏家訓．風操》：「凡避諱者，皆須得其同訓以代換之：桓公名白，博有五皓之稱；厲王名長，琴有修短之目。」 「 換 」表示變易、改變。如《後漢書．朱馮虞鄭周列傳》：「而間者守宰數見換易，迎新相代，疲勞道路。」唐代王勃〈滕王閣〉：「閑雲潭影日悠悠，物換星移幾度秋。」 「 換 」還表示借貸。《玉篇．手部》：「換，貸也。」如《世說新語．雅量》：「後以其性儉家富，說太傅令換千萬，冀其有吝，于此可乘。」
From " hand" to " huan" sound. The original meaning is exchange. "Shuowen": "Change, easy. Congshou, Huansheng." Such as "Han Shu. "Xue Xuan Zhu Bo Biography": "(Xue) Xuan exchanges the counties with Ling Zuo (Yin) and (Xue) Gong. The two look at things for several months, and both counties are governed." Li Bai of the Tang Dynasty "Jiang Jinjiu": " Five-flowered horses, golden hairs, and Hu'er will exchange fine wines, and sell their sorrows with you." " Exchange" means replacement or replacement. Such as "Mozi. "Prepare the Gate of the City" "When you reach the gate of the city, you will change the staff, and if you don't change it, you can raise it, you don't have to go to the city." It means that when the enemy comes, you need to change the staff and guard from time to time, but you don't need to change the staff, because the staff does not need Up the city wall. Another example is "The Family Instructions of Yan Family. "Feng Cao": "Anyone who avoids taboos must be given the same training in order to replace them: Huan Gong's name is Bai, Bo is known as Wu Hao; Li Wang is long, and Qin has short eyes." " Change" means change and change. Such as "Hou Han Shu. "Zhu Fengyu and Zheng Zhou's Biographies": "While the one who keeps the slaughter sees easy changes, welcomes the new generation, and fatigues the road." Wang Bo of the Tang Dynasty (Tengwang Pavilion): "The leisure cloud pool has a long shadow day, and things change and stars move several times in autumn." " Exchange" also means borrowing. "Jade articles. "Hand": "Change, loan also." Such as "Shi Shuo New Language." "Yaliang": "Later, he used his frugality to make his family wealthy, saying that the Taifu's order was exchanged for tens of millions, hoping that he would be stingy, and he could take advantage of it."

Liushutong characters (2)

換字的基本解释

換
huàn
同“换”。

換字的汉语字典释义

[①]［huàn］
［《廣韻》胡玩切，去换，匣。］
“換1”的新字形。
(1)更易；改变。
(2)谓换取。
(3)对调；调换。
(4)借贷。
(5)旧时称黄金、珍珠等与货币的比价。如每两黄金值一百元时，称之一百换。
(6)见“畔换”。

換字的康熙字典解释

【卯集中】【手字部】　換； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页442第14
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?胡玩切，音逭。讀若完去聲。【說文】易也。【晉書·阮孚傳】嘗以金貂換酒。　又【前漢·敘傳】項氏畔換。【註】孟康曰：畔，反也。換，易也。師古曰：畔換，强恣貌。猶言跋扈也。【左思·魏都賦】雲散叛換。【註】叛換，猶恣睢也。【集韻】作愌。　又于眷切，音院。【蘇轍·送孫提?詩】依依東軒竹，凜凜故人面。詔書遂公私，使節許新換。从手从側人从穴从廾。俗作换，非。

考證：〔【左思·魏都賦】雲散叛換。【註】換，猶恣睢也。〕　謹照原文註下增叛字。
換字的源字形

小篆楷体

字形对比：

換字的起名意思

暂无。

change
Basic explanation of words
change
huàn
Same as "change".
change
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［huàn］
["Guangyun" play and cut, change, box. ]
The new glyph of "Change 1".
(1) Easier; change.
(2) The exchange is called.
(3) Swap; swap.
(4) Borrowing.
(5) In the old days, it was called the ratio of gold, pearls, etc. to currency. For example, when every two pieces of gold are worth one hundred yuan, it is called one hundred exchange.
(6) See "Pan Swap".
change

[Mao Collection] [Hand Character Department] 　 Huan; Kangxi Strokes: 13; Page Number: Page 442-14
[Guang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Positive Rhyme]? Hu Wanqie, sound 逭. If you finish reading it. [Said Wen] Yi Ye. [Book of Jin · Ruan Fu Biography] Taste the gold mink for wine.　[Previous Han·Xu Chuan] Xiang Shipan changed. [Note] Meng Kang said: Bank, the other way around. Change, easy too. Shi Gu said: Changing the bank, strong looks. Still domineering. [Zuo Si·Wei Du Fu] Yun San rebelled. [Note] Rebellion is still arrogant. 【Ji Yun】make stunned.　 Yujuan cut again, Sound Academy. [Su Che·Send Sun Ti? Poetry] Yiyi Dongxuanzhu, the face of the old man. The edict was public and private, and the envoys were exchanged. From the hand from the side, the person from the acupuncture point from the 廾. Vulgar, non. Textual research: [[Zuo Si·Wei Du Fu] Yun San defected. [Note] Change, still look at it. 〕 　 I would like to add the word treason based on the original text.

Name meaning

huàn
вм. 换
Radicals: 扌, 勹, 口, 儿, 大  (fingers, prison, mouth, legs, big)
Meaning Mnemonic
In prison, when you have access to a big number of fingers, mouths, and legs you can exchange them for things that are worth more to you. What are you gonna do with all these body parts in prison? You should exchange them for cigarettes and toilet alcohol.
You just have so many fingers, mouths, and legs you've pummeled off of the other prisoners. Exchange them for better loot!
Reading Mnemonic
You learned this type of exchange from the mighty Genghis Khan (かん). You read a book or watched a show about him once and you're pretty positive that Genghis Khan would exchange the body parts of his enemies all over the continents of Asia and Europe for nicer stuff.
Think back to when you were a kid and they would roll out those TVs on stands into the classrooms. Imagine watching a documentary on Genghis Khan's exchange routes where he bought and sold body parts. Educational!

儿 (ножки), 冂 (перевёрнутая коробка), 勹 (обёртка), 大 (большой), 扎
